Title: Integration Testing with xUnit

Title: Records Deep Dive: What, Why and How | NDC Melbourne 2021
Description: Records were a new feature introduced in C# 9 that allow concise definition of immutable data classes that you may have already seen or even used. In order to support them there were also related new concepts introduced like "primary constructors", "init accessors" and "with expressions", and there are also some traps with records that you should be aware of, like for example I probably shouldn't have referred to them as "immutable data classes".

Title: New PetitPotam attack allows take over of Windows domains
Description: A new NTLM relay attack called PetitPotam has been discovered that allows threat actors to take over a domain controller, and thus an entire Windows domain.

Description: The website and blog of Felipe Lima.

Title: Notes on Windows 11 - Jorge Pinto
Description: - I have no idea what Windows 'Insider' means, I don't know if I'm using a public beta, a Release Candidate or just a fake PR build. I honestly don't know if this build is actually an ad. I don't even remember how I became an 'Insider' in the first place. Did I fill out a form years ago or is MS giving these licences away like candy with a shiny button to get free-pass on Early-Access shenanigans? Of course I could just read the build documentation but my point is I shouldn't have to. They used to call these things alphas, betas, RCs, etc. for a reason. Windows 11 [/ VSC] 'Insiders' means nothing. And it's dumb. It's like calling it Windows VIP (which admitedly, sounds kinda cool - better that 'Insiders', for sure).

Title: How to spot a good fake ID – Trevor Klee
